result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin T. Kamrath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 20 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 4/4/16
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt:
15CM203 & 15CM494 - Defendant Benjamin T. Kamrath in court with attorney Eugene Joseph Kirschbaum.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  NC plea entered in Count 1 of 15CM203 w/o the dangerous weapon enhancer, NC plea entered in Count 3 of 15CM203 and NC plea entered in Count 1 of 15CM494.  Court accepts plea's and finds def G.  Count 2 in 15CM203 is DRI. State heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Kirschbaum responds.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

Counts 1 & 3 in 15CM203:

w/h sentence - 2 yrs probation
20 days DCJ w/h&t as COP comm. 4/4/16
court costs - apply bond posted 
any counseling as directed by agent
AODA
maintain absolute sobriety
no drugs
no bars
no violent or abusive contact w/anyone
no use or possession of firearms

Count 1 in 15CM494:

impose & stay 9 mos DCJ

Defendant Benjamin T. Kamrath in court with attorney Eugene Joseph Kirschbaum.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Thompson heard; will be filing new case, requesting adjournment to settle both cases. Discussion held. Court reschedules P&S. Atty Kirschbaum heard; request appointment on new case once filed. Court heard and extends appointment to that new case once filed also.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Benjamin T. Kamrath in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant filed Petition for Ct Appt Counsel. Court appoints Atty Kirschbaum at rate of $100/month comm 8/15/15 and 15th of each month through wage assignment.

9:14 - Defendant, Benjamin T. Kamrath in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court enters Not Guilty plea on defendant's behalf. Court sets $150 Cash bond (as previously posted) with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not have alcohol within his residence.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not possess any firearms.  Return date scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
